text: Abernathyite is a pale, yellow-colored mineral that forms crystals. It was named for Jess Abernathy, the person who found the first samples of this mineral. It is found in a mine in Emery County, in the United States. It is highly radioactive. Chemically, it is a hydrate of potassium uranyl arsenate. It has the chemical formula . == References == Category:Arsenate minerals Category:Uranyl minerals
title: Abernathyite
